results.title: Lisinopril attenuates acute hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction in humans.
results.text_hl: Likewise, the TPR response to @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxemia@@@ was significantly blunted by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@: 124 dyne.s.cm-5 vs placebo 179 dyne.s.cm-5 (95% CI, 11, 99).

citations.NLM: Cargill RI, Lipworth BJ. Lisinopril attenuates acute hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction in humans. Chest. 1996 Feb;109(2):424-9. PMID: 8620717
citations.BibTeX: @article{8620717, title={Lisinopril attenuates acute hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction in humans.}, author={Cargill RI and Lipworth BJ}, journal={Chest}, volume={109}, number={2}, pages={424-9}}

results.title: Involvement of Renin-Angiotensin System in Retinopathy of Prematurity - A Possible Target for Therapeutic Intervention
results.text_hl: ERG & fundus studies in @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@OIR@@@ revealed the altered function of retina and were successfully prevented by ARB (@CHEMICAL_Telmisartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077333 @@@telmisartan@@@), ACEI (@<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@) and @CHEMICAL_Bevacizumab @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068258 @@@bevacizumab@@@.

citations.NLM: Nath M, Chandra P, Halder N, Singh B, Deorari AK, Kumar A, Azad R, Velpandian T. Involvement of Renin-Angiotensin System in Retinopathy of Prematurity - A Possible Target for Therapeutic Intervention PLoS One. 2016;11(12):e0168809. PMID: 28033392
citations.BibTeX: @article{28033392, title={Involvement of Renin-Angiotensin System in Retinopathy of Prematurity - A Possible Target for Therapeutic Intervention}, author={Nath M and Chandra P and Halder N and Singh B and Deorari AK and Kumar A and Azad R and Velpandian T}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={11}, number={12}, pages={e0168809}}

results.title: Lack of interaction of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors with muscarinic and neuropeptide Y receptors.
results.text_hl: In studies conducted in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ undergoing cardiac catheterizations, some hemodynamic changes were observed after the acute sublingual administration of the angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors (ACEI) @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@. These changes consisted of an increase in pulmonary artery pressure, pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) and induction of @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@.

citations.NLM: Silva WI, Sanabria P, Altieri PI. Lack of interaction of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors with muscarinic and neuropeptide Y receptors. P R Health Sci J. 1994 Mar;13(1):25-8. PMID: 8016291
citations.BibTeX: @article{8016291, title={Lack of interaction of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors with muscarinic and neuropeptide Y receptors.}, author={Silva WI and Sanabria P and Altieri PI}, journal={P R Health Sci J}, volume={13}, number={1}, pages={25-8}}
